questions.question: What are the two fundamental elements used in Morse code Alphabets?

explanations.a: In Morse code, dots represent short signals (dits), and lines are not used to represent characters.
explanations.b: Morse code primarily uses dots and dashes, not squares, to represent characters.
explanations.c: Morse code uses dashes (dahs), it does not use lines to represent characters.
